thread.title: EDF says Flamanville reactor delayed to 2018, cost 10.5 bln
thread.title_full: EDF says Flamanville reactor delayed to 2018, cost 10.5 bln

title: EDF says Flamanville reactor delayed to 2018, cost 10.5 bln
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Sep 3, 2015, 07:51 BST - UK Markets open in 9 mins. EDF says Flamanville reactor delayed to 2018, cost 10.5 bln Reuters - UK Focus – 18 minutes ago 19.17 -3.80 
PARIS, Sept 3 (Reuters) - French state-controlled utility EDF (Paris: FR0010242511 - news ) said on Thursday the EPR nuclear reactor it is building in Flamanville, Normandy, will again be delayed to 2018 and raised the cost estimate to 10.5 billion euros ($11.85 billion) from an initial budget of 3 billion. 
Commercial start-up of the Areva (Paris: FR0011027143 - news ) -designed EPR reactor - of which EDF plans to build two in Hinkley Point, Britain - has been delayed several times, most recently in November, when EDF (Hanover: E2F.HA - news ) said it expected the EPR to go only in 2017. 
Construction in Flamanville started at end-2007 and the reactor had been scheduled to start up in 2012. ($1 = 0.8862 euros) (Reporting by Geert De Clercq, Editing by dominique Vidalon) Tax cuts, pensions, childcare, online accounts and beer duty, here's … Related Stock Articles Follow the quotes you care about most.
